lab.summary: Sensor readings show a local subspace distortion near the ship’s warp field boundary.

answers.text: Recalibrate the subspace field sensors and conduct a low-level warp field modulation test.
answers.details: Maintains safety margins while verifying sensor reliability and field stability.

answers.text: Run a gravimetric scan to determine if the distortion is naturally occurring or induced.
answers.details: Identifies the nature of the anomaly, though not an immediate corrective action.

answers.text: Notify Engineering to temporarily increase warp core output for better data resolution.
answers.details: Provides higher data fidelity but risks additional field disturbance.

answers.text: Ignore the readings; subspace anomalies are common and usually self-correcting.
answers.details: Neglects potential hazards; subspace fluctuations can destabilize warp geometry.

answers.text: Attempt to neutralize the distortion by generating a counter-frequency pulse without analysis.
answers.details: Acting without diagnostic confirmation risks amplifying the anomaly.

lab.summary: A newly discovered microbial organism exhibits rapid adaptation to containment protocols.

answers.text: Quarantine the organism under level-4 containment and analyze its adaptive genome in isolation.
answers.details: Ensures safety and enables scientific study within secure conditions.

answers.text: Adjust containment frequency fields incrementally while monitoring mutation rate.
answers.details: Adaptive containment shows initiative but carries moderate exposure risk.

answers.text: Deploy a sterilization field to eliminate all traces immediately.
answers.details: Prevents spread but forfeits valuable research potential.

answers.text: Lower containment levels to test the organism’s tolerance thresholds.
answers.details: Unethical and dangerous; violates Starfleet xenobiology protocol.

answers.text: Expose the organism to transporter pattern filters to ‘edit out’ unwanted traits.
answers.details: Transporter-based genetic manipulation without clearance breaches Federation medical law.

lab.summary: Astrometric data from long-range sensors returns contradictory readings on stellar mass composition.

answers.text: Cross-reference with nearby probe telemetry and recalibrate the sensor array’s spectral filters.
answers.details: Standard Starfleet correction ensuring data integrity and alignment with probe standards.

answers.text: Conduct a diagnostic on the sensor grid using controlled subspace interference patterns.
answers.details: Effective for isolating distortion sources in the long-range sensor network.

answers.text: Recompile previous scans using predictive data smoothing algorithms.
answers.details: Reasonable for trend analysis, though it risks masking real anomalies.

answers.text: Dismiss the discrepancy as software drift and proceed with current readings.
answers.details: Fails to verify data reliability; Starfleet science demands empirical accuracy.

answers.text: Attempt to compensate by amplifying the array’s subspace gain beyond calibration limits.
answers.details: Overamplification risks permanent sensor damage and false-positive readings.

lab.summary: A spatial survey detects an intermittent energy signature with no apparent source or pattern.

answers.text: Record the phenomenon and deploy a Class-II probe to gather localized readings.
answers.details: Follows Starfleet scientific procedure for safe remote data collection.

answers.text: Adjust sensor modulation to enhance detection range and frequency discrimination.
answers.details: Improves signal clarity while maintaining safe observational distance.

answers.text: Compare the readings to known subspace interference patterns from previous missions.
answers.details: Provides useful context but does not directly verify the anomaly’s cause.

answers.text: Initiate direct energy scans without containment protocols.
answers.details: Risks feedback interference; unsafe without field dampeners in place.

answers.text: Attempt to match the frequency and emit a return pulse to 'communicate' with the anomaly.
answers.details: Speculative and hazardous; risks resonance or subspace rupture.

lab.summary: A trace radiation leak is detected near the warp core’s plasma conduit junctions.

answers.text: Evacuate engineering staff, seal affected sections, and deploy containment fields.
answers.details: Prioritizes crew safety and follows Starfleet emergency radiation protocols.

answers.text: Conduct a level-2 diagnostic to identify microfractures in the plasma conduits.
answers.details: Efficient diagnostic approach that isolates potential structural issues safely.

answers.text: Deploy sensor drones to scan the core environment for radiation variance.
answers.details: Effective remote scanning solution with minimal exposure risk.

answers.text: Increase ventilation flow to disperse radiation particles naturally.
answers.details: Ineffective and unsafe; dispersal spreads contamination instead of containing it.

answers.text: Bypass the containment alert system to avoid false positives until further notice.
answers.details: Violates Starfleet safety regulations; endangers crew and ship integrity.
